abstract: The Supreme Court upheld a $290 million jury award to a small Canadian software firm in a dispute over a method of editing documents.
snippet: The Supreme Court upheld a $290 million jury award to a small Canadian software firm in a dispute over a method of editing documents.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday unanimously upheld a $290 million award against Microsoft in a patent dispute. The case was brought by a Canadian software company, i4i Limited Partnership, which said a version of Microsoft Word had infringed its patented method for editing documents.

headline.main: Microsoft Loses Final Appeal in $290 Million Patent Case
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Loses Final Appeal in $290 Million Patent Case
